Text.Value: Zevlor let you down - but he did his best.
I freed Zevlor from the colony. I wouldn't be surprised if he made it out.
If I had coin, I wouldn't be travelling overland through a cursed warzone.
There are less mouths to feed now, but we still need supplies for the road. We'll scavenge what we can.
I'll give you a pass for now, but you owe me.
True enough. He wouldn't follow me into battle.
But the best leaders know they're only as good as the people around them. Zevlor told me that.
I freed Zevlor down in the colony.  I wouldn't be so quick to write him off as dead.
I couldn't have done it without Jaheira, and the Harpers.
Turns out the people around him were better than him. Guess he got what was coming to him.
*The briefest hesitation, as Cerys wars with old loyalties. And wins.*
I'm just glad you're safe.
If you ever need help again - ask somebody else.
I looked up to him - we all did. But he let us down when we needed him most.
I wouldn't be so sure Zevlor's dead.
I'm glad we agree it was a job - I don't tend to do those for free, you know.
People get paid for doing jobs - cough up the coin.
It might not last. They looked up to Zevlor too - until he left them for dead. Guess he got what was coming to him.
Back in Last Light, I was racking my brains - how the hells do we get past the curse?
Didn't think we'd make it without the old Hellrider to lead us. But you did a damn fine job.
You're too humble.
You're worse than Zevlor - at least he didn't put a price on our survival.
Only joking - my good heart will be the death of me one day.
You're better off without Zevlor - good riddance.
You deserve some of the credit - they look up to you.
Good riddance.
I won't feel safe until we're behind city walls. With Zevlor gone, it's up to me to make sure the survivors reach Baldur's Gate.
I would. He didn't have any fight left in him.
You shouldn't speak ill of the dead - Zevlor did his best.
Baldur's Gate lies ahead, we just need to avoid an army, the remnants of the curse, and whatever else wants to eat us alive.
I wish things had ended differently for him.
I'm going to scavenge what supplies I can to make sure my people are fed on the road.
And then, a blinding light cuts through the darkness, like a blade through butter. All thanks to you, I hear.
Let it lie.
Hopefully we'll see you again in the city.
I hope not. Good hearts deserve long lives.
Nightsong's the real hero here - she was the light in the darkness.
Clear off. I have enough friends to help me survive the road - I don't need mercenaries.
He went his own way. I don't think he could face me - or all of you.

Synopsis: Cerys is preparing to lead the surviving tieflings onwards to Baldur’s Gate. Shocked to have survived the Shadow-Cursed Lands, she finds herself taking responsibility for the others - in Zevlor’s absence. It’s not a role she ever wanted, but somebody has to do it. She’s adjusting to a life without Zevlor, and briefly reflects on his surrender and presumed death.
